de.mrapp.textmining.util.metrics

Class LevenshteinDissimilarity

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.textmining.util.metrics.LevenshteinDissimilarity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TextMetric

    public class LevenshteinDissimilarity
extends java.lang.Object
implements TextMetric
    Hamming dissimilarity is the loss metric pendant to the LevenshteinDistance. It measures the percentage of single-character edits (insertions, deletions, or substitutions) that are necessary to change one text into another among the number of characters of the longer of both texts. Hamming dissimilarity always evaluates to heuristic values within the interval [0,1]. Texts that evaluate to greater heuristic values are considered to be less similar than texts that evaluate to smaller heuristic values.
    Since:
    1.0.0

      • isGainMetric

        public final boolean isGainMetric()
        Description copied from interface: TextMetric
        Returns, whether the metric is a gain metric, i.e. that two strings that evaluate to a greater heuristic value are considered to be more similar than two strings that evaluate to a smaller heuristic value.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        True, if the gain metric is a gain metric, false, if the metric is a loss metric
